item.title: Session 15
item.description:
About 3 months ago Standing on the exact bridge in current time is the Tekina of Tsuchigomo, slamming a fist into the wall as the bridge shakes
A servant cowers, presenting Ganra a box... "Tell me who sent it, or you will get the same fate"... Apparently CeolğŸ”¥ sent it. "I let you run among with the rest of your rats and this is how I am repaid?! I will tear him apart. LEAVE. Or I will see you are crushed."
Ganra screams out in fury, slowly falling to his knees as he holds the side of the box. The box contains the remains of Kazera.
Tsuga Kitakuri stands in front of us, a blade of glass stabbed into the ground. Ornately dressed in non-metal armor with 3 pistols on his hip... "I know why you are here..."
"I'll turn 29 this fall. I'm a young man, second youngest to ever become a Samurai. I have a lot to learn. I have not seen the Great War, been a servant under Timbatzu Azuna, and I have not been the Second Aikon of Fire. But I have never been a stupid man. So I question why you are here. Why you exist. Your kind aren't meant to be here. Perhaps your father hid you. But there is no chance that the Gintsuii don't know. You must be some sort of experiment. And I'm here to kill you. I don't know why you exist, but I don't need to. Behind this door is a truth that will shatter our world. A truth that we don't need. Please, I am giving you all a chance. Turn around. We can forget this happened. Lay low. Let the war pass. Live in peace. You'll hurt so many people if you uncover this truth. Please. Turn around."
The Samurai have probably known this for 20 years, maybe more. We make our way down, it seems to be completely cleared out.
Tsuga Kitakuri is waiting for HerağŸ‘¿... He wields a giant blade: "That's far enough."
We see the resolve of a Samurai, the face of someone that knows they now have to try... A face that HerağŸ‘¿ has not seen from her father.
"I am Tsuga Kitakuri, beast of Ikcho. Fall before the war god, fall before a beast!"
Tsuga Kitakuri draws his large Odachi... We almost all die...
HerağŸ‘¿ stands up, blocking armageddon with black leaves and branches "8th leaf is faith, 9th is good luck... and the tenth... leaf feeds off of resolve... SHE'S A DEVIL"
There's usually between 6-7 leaves on Levin The door tries to stop us... "Danger. Cannot stop you. Turn back. Death" We go further in... We see a chair in the middle of a room, a giant crystal floating in the air. Someone is floating to the side with long white hair
This is Ikcho, he disappeared 200 years ago. The person in the chair is 4 feet tall max... A dwarf? But the skin is so clung to their body, their skin clings to the ribs as if it's holding them together. This person hasn't eaten in a long time. They are dead, or at least appear to be Then we see the lungs expand and slowly go back down.... On top of this figure's head is a crest of red hair.
"My father. Hermit. Betrayer. Yori. Yori. Yori. CeolğŸ”¥. CeolğŸ”¥. CeolğŸ”¥."
It is CeolğŸ”¥'s son, Yori... But... he saw him die? Not a son. A Name. A number. A tool a product. A father. Not a father. Thing. Thing. Thing.. Apotheosis. Fate. Fate. Fate. Renewal. Past. Despair. Decay.
CeolğŸ”¥ goes in to touch him... "THREAT LEVEL PRIMUS. THREAT." "Powering up. 20%. 40%. Influx. Influx. Influx."
Ikcho's eyes go dark and looks at WahlenğŸ’«
WahlenğŸ’« feels a stab wound in his side, as in his memories. "Creature. Darkness of the night."
Ikcho's eyes start glowing, Yori is yanked upwards and constructs start to form in front of us. They are made of silver and gold energy.
Macko rears back, firing water and constricting the prim guardian...
Ikcho sees this: "Brother?"
CeolğŸ”¥ my father. My Family. Yori the last tool. The last object. Father. "I know not what you are. Hear me. Free me. I will take his place. Porcelain figure of pure white light, face contours look humanoid, but it looks a little too perfect. What should be eyes are deep black spheres. It moves its hands up, splitting into 5 pieces. "Now, you will become one. One last time" Ceol smashes it, stopping it. Ikcho has been repelled. This treachery will not last.
Serai comes to save us. Akaza comes in, cloaked. I know you're there Velorah.
"Oh. you learned our name. What else have you learned. Ryu"
You seek the power of Arutsua, the power of the forgotten twins. If you want them, come through me.
A dome of fire from Akaza encapsulates Velorah. I am ryu, I am the flames of destruction. The flames of life! Velorah enters Akaza's chest, fire leaving and him vomiting blood.

item.title: (7) Fanning Embers
item.description: As they arrived in a new place underground, held up by broken pieces of a Taor ruin. Ruiâ›„ was carried to a makeshift medical bay, where Yari healed her as best as he could. Paragus then spoke to each party member one by one, asking about what happened at Ninnan Gate. After speaking to everyone. He gathered the group and told them that his small hideaway for deserters, outlaws, and heretics was open to them as long as they needed. But asked them for help in finding the Second Tekina of FireğŸ’« which they all agreed. Now they have been ordered to rest and settle in. After some rest and sheltering from a massive storm, the group set out towards a nearby village, Lostwing, to pick up the trail on the Second Aikon of Fire. As they made their way through a large bamboo forest, the Guardian was following them. After a fight and some mistakes from WahlenğŸ’«, the guardian continued to follow them, although far slower. As they arrived in Lostwing, it was dead silent. As they made their way through the small village, they found the scout for Paragus, Enokaga (gator lady), and a small group of bearers that had been interrogated. After being discovered by a Royal scout (soldier from Yatari), they ran into Kazera, the Tekina of the Wind. She summoned a creature that the group quickly dispatched of before Paragus and Enokaga arrived Enokaga. Kazera revealed that Paragus was a previous commander for Yatari. Before the two could fight, Kazera was called away as one of the soldiers called out that Royal forces had secured the Tekina. With a blast of wind, the Tekina and Royalists disappeared. Enokaga was then sent after to pick up their trail leaving the group to rest.

item.title: (8) Inferno in the Night
item.description: In the middle of the night, the group was woken up by Paragus. Enokaga had found that the royalists were holed up in a nearby fort last used in the Great War. After fighting through Royalist forces, they were corralled into a shrine to Levin where Kazera waited for them, she and Paragus had a small spat about him leaving Yatari. It came to a head with the two brawling and Paragus having the advantage before two summons overpowered him, leading to a swift defeat. Kazera then ordered her summons to kill the party and after a few moments they came out victorious. A very battered and heavily injured Paragus told them to stop Kazera as she had wings and could easily fly away with the second Tekina of fire. As they made their way to the rooftop of the fort, Kazera offered for them to be part of Yatari which the party quickly declined. A brutal fight ensued with many close calls, bountiful strokes of luck, and unrelenting will. But they had defeated the Tekina of wind. As Hera went to deliver the final blow, ribbons of green energy came from Kazera and went into Wahlenâ€™s chest before spreading to each party member. The four fell to the ground in pain and screamed in agony before Wahlen heard a â€˜there you areâ€™. A memory then ensued for Wahlen where he was seemingly in a much more technologically advanced world on a ship with his friend Ohara Sachio. The memory ended with a black haired and well dressed man with an ethereal purple sword saying â€˜Iâ€™m waiting, Wahlenâ€™. As the group awoke, they all felt they had booms of power. As Kazera stood once again to kill them, her magic seemed to be gone. After being evacuated by Royal soldiers, they fled into the forest. Rui pursued and slaughtered the remaining guards with Kazera only being left. With a scream, a tempest raged around them forming a tornado as Tengu arose, blowing away Rui. As the group exited the fort, they saw the tempest raging and consuming the forest while Wahlen heard a calling from the tornado. After much disagreement, the group made their way into the tornado where only Wahlen, Paragus, and Macko saw a hooded man. As they continued, the hooded man stopped at a cliff's edge, Wahlen asked who he was, and what could be seen from him just smiled and fell off the cliff before Tengu attacked them. After another brutal fight, Wahlen took an opportunity to finish off Tengu, and after much wrangling and slashing, he had killed Tengu and was on a different floating island in the tornado. Moments later, Tengu rose again, no worse for wear as it was seemingly just playing with its prey. It began to squeeze Wahlen, cracking ribs and squeezing him to death. Wahlenâ€™s last words were: â€˜I will not let you stand in my way!â€™

item.title: (6) A Chance Encounter
item.description:
As the party has joined House Liotus heading Northward, winter draws ever closer. They are still a minimum of a three month travel from the border without weather delays. 
As winter came full force to the traveling caravan, they were significantly slowed down. As time went on, more and more people started going missing from the caravan until the remnants of the group were encountered by a small group of Yokai. The party vanquished them leaving them as the only survivors of the caravan. On the Yokai were simple instructions. "Bring me WahlenğŸ’« and CeolğŸ”¥, signed, your lord."
They then went to House Aclassi's estate where Serai asked HerağŸ‘¿ to attend a meeting in Iron Blossom Keep to see why her father was invited. Now they travel, hopefully to avoid the oncoming battle which could possibly start the first declaration of war after Uloneâ€™s death. 
As they arrived, HerağŸ‘¿ was greeted by Ganra Dokugan, showing her what HerağŸ‘¿â€™s father was participating in. His creations were gemstones fused with pieces of the once thought indestructible Taor ruins allowing the non magically inclined to cast spells with seemingly no limit. After showing his work, HerağŸ‘¿ and Ganra made their way to the summit between Yatari and Ikcho. Throughout the summit, Yatari was obviously disinterested in an alliance while Ikcho was outraged at this, implying they had dealings in the past. After nearly an hour of discussion, Ganra proudly proclaimed that Tsuchigomo would take the field. HerağŸ‘¿ was told to leave but managed to snoop on a conversation between Ganra and a woman from Yatari, Kazera, the Tekina of the Wind. In her snooping, HerağŸ‘¿ could tell that they were more than friendly in stark contrast between their regions. As she left, HerağŸ‘¿ saw the carnage of the battlefield and the group decided they needed to make a quick exit. As they began to leave, the group was ambushed and stopped by a group of bearers from the Holy Empire. After determining that they were friends of Ikcho, the bearers put away their weapons and introduced themselves as the Pale Blades. Biast was the leader, Aevis seemingly the scout, and Wyvern the â€˜hinge of the operationâ€™. As the bearers tried to evacuate them, Tsuchigomo rose up causing mayhem to the battlefield only for Yuki-Onna to rise as well thus creating a chaotic fight between Aikons which the party was at mercy to the collateral damage. After several minutes of evading boulders, splits in the earth, massive icicles, and the massive form of Tsuchigomo, they finally were spared a moment to breathe. As they pressed forward, the bearers found their target, the Tekina of Ice. They quickly moved in to kill her along with the Umi Kiba and the party joined them. Ruiâ›„ managed to stab the Tekina of Ice which the Tekina simply said â€˜thank youâ€™ before grabbing onto Ruiâ›„â€™s head causing a mass amount of pain until Ruiâ›„ fell unconscious and the Tekina laid dead. Biast commanded Wyvern to take Ruiâ›„â€™s head as he didnâ€™t wish to take any chances with strange magic. Wyvern went to kill her but with his large dog, Akira, trying to stop him and recognizing her white skin, Wyvern realized he recognized her. Aevis pushed aside Wyvern as he went catatonic only for Aevis to be killed by reinforcements from the Umi Kiba. After the party dispatched them, Biast ordered Wyvern to kill Ruiâ›„ which Wyvern denied and began to fight Biast. After another fight that began to wear the party down, Wyvern was revealed to be Macko Shuki. More reinforcements arrived from the Umi Kiba only for a deafening roar to sound as lightning struck, spreading to each and every Umi Kiba, kicking up dust. From the dust, Paragus Kou emerged, telling the group to follow him through a portal as Ruiâ›„â€™s blinding pain began to return.

item.title: (5) Superstitions Put to Steel
item.description: The four were able to pull themselves out of the rushing river, where they finally were able to take a breath. Enokaga revealed to them that they had been captured for nearly half a year, given they were in the North Eastern part of Ikcho. Not wanting to stay any longer than they had to, the party made their way to a roadside inn after a long day of traveling. The inn keeper was hesitant to let them in given it was the night of Veylfall, a night every quarter of the year where it is believed the more monstrous parts of the world become braver and more viscous. They eventually convinced him and they were let in and got some rest. The innkeeper mentioned his son hadnâ€™t come back and the party offered to find him. Overjoyed, the innkeeper gave WahlenğŸ’« a good luck charm of Levin and said his son wore its twin. They then set off to find his son at a sacrificial area known as Bloodshore Rock. With HerağŸ‘¿â€™s arrival coming just before they left, the group set off to Bloodshore Rock and found nearly fifty feral Abhumans along with a man dressed in red silk robes and a fox max with a tied and gagged man in tow. As he chanted, the party intervened, cutting through the mass amount of bodies until Ruiâ›„ was able to kill the man revealing it was the innkeeper's son. WahlenğŸ’« then grabbed the man's blade causing a vision and a surge of power in the party. Right after this happened, the Taor ruins lit up with a guardian moving towards them to which they fled, going back to the inn. Along the way, they met a noble house at arms, Clan Liotus, finishing off the Abhumans that escaped the partyâ€™s wrath. They got a ride from them to the inn where they discovered the innkeeper holed up in his room with dozens upon dozens of tiny holes each containing a small worm that made up the food they had eaten. The innkeeper said that his name did not matter and that he was now something called Legion. Legion claimed that the time of the Yokai has been forgotten, and they will have their due. item.title: (4) A Guttering Light

The last thing that was seen was the party being pulled out of rubble. The only thing left living at Ninnan Gate seemingly. 
Fading in and out of deep slumber and being fed berries that nourished them while also keeping them in said deep slumber, the party found themselves in shackles on a cart. In the brief moments they awoke, they realized they each were in a cell, still shackled, and being questioned. Over many loops of falling into a slumber, awaking in a haze, and being questioned, the loop had finally ended. A small group consisting of Yari Talvec, Paragus and Barolt Kou, Enokaga Aritomi, and one other eluded to break CeolğŸ”¥, Ruiâ›„, and WahlenğŸ’« out. item.title: Tabaxi
item.description: Also known as â€˜Noyonaâ€™, they are a race of felines, sometimes having only cat eyes and other times looking entirely like a cat. They are the oldest of the more uncommon races as it is said that Ulone created them. There are even some rumors that one was his wife.

item.title: Half Elves
item.description: The start of the less common races, half elves are spared persecution due to their ancestors switching sides in the Great War. But they are on a very thin line. Itâ€™s not uncommon for them to be refused service. Just penance for their ancestors' actions.

item.title: Halfling
item.description: One of the newer races, it is said that Levin took the holy parts of the Dwarves to create a new race fit. These are rather uncommon but often have kind souls and generally fit right in with Dwarves.

item.title: Dragonborn
item.description: Said to be an offshoot of the Yuan-Ti, Dragonborn are incredibly rare and are rumored to be fallen scales from the Heili dragons. No one has confirmed if this is true, but as of right now, itâ€™s treated as fact.

item.title: Dwarves
item.description: The second most common race. However unlike humans they are often revered due to simply being the same race as Ulone. They might even get a pass for not addressing a samurai as â€˜lordâ€™ or â€˜ladyâ€™.

item.title: Bearers
item.description: This name is given to the mutant races or ones that naturally have magic, excluding Yuan-ti and Triton, They are also known as the â€˜slave raceâ€™ or â€˜Markedâ€™ as they are property for the superior races. Ink is cast on their face to mark them, removal of this brand carries the possibility of death as poison can leak into veins. Buying a new bearer is commonplace, but the bearers who are able to fight cost quite a good amount. Attempting to remove their brand is punishable by death for the bearer and anyone involved.
